meanings.definition: The absence of bacteria, viruses, and other microorganisms.
meanings.sent1: Proper asepsis in the hospital helps keep patients safe from harmful germs.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use asepsis to ensure that surgical tools are clean and free of any harmful organisms.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power was asepsis, allowing him to destroy all germs with a single touch.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against infection, asepsis is the knight in shining armor, protecting the body from invaders.
meanings.sent5: Asepsis is like a shield, guarding against the invisible enemies that can make us sick.

meanings.definition: The practice of preventing infection by maintaining a sterile environment.
meanings.sent1: Nurses diligently follow asepsis protocols to keep hospital rooms clean and safe for patients.
meanings.sent2: Asepsis is crucial in food preparation to avoid contamination and ensure consumer safety.
meanings.sent3: The chef's commitment to asepsis in the kitchen led to perfectly cooked meals every time.
meanings.sent4: The asepsis of the laboratory was so strict that even a speck of dust was considered a threat.
meanings.sent5: Asepsis is the guardian angel of health, watching over us and warding off harmful pathogens.

meanings.definition: The state of being free from disease-causing organisms.
meanings.sent1: The asepsis of the water supply is essential to prevent the spread of waterborne illnesses.
meanings.sent2: Asepsis in the air ventilation system helps maintain a healthy indoor environment.
meanings.sent3: The cat's asepsis was so effective that even the mice stayed away from the house.
meanings.sent4: The garden's asepsis was so impeccable that not a single plant fell victim to pests.
meanings.sent5: Asepsis is the shield that keeps us safe from the microscopic foes that can make us sick.
